title: I got 10/40in ISA 1, 16/40in ISA 2 20 in lab 10 in assignment and I would get 13 in ESA in physics (5credits) will I pass? Please help me
content: I got 10/40in ISA 1, 16/40in ISA 2  20 in lab 10 in assignment and I would get 13 in ESA in physics (5credits) will I pass? Please help me

comments.body: It depends on moderation and how hard the paper was, if you can tell your marks clearly out of 50(ISA and assignment) then I can guess. But idts you pass.

In ISA2 16/40
ASSIGNMENT 10
LAB 20
Soo thats a total of 23/50 which is isa1-2+assignment

If you're overall score including isa,esa assignment,lab is more than 42 out of 120, then you are 90% passed. But please focus on other exams and next sem, because as a senior, these grades are worth their weight in gold.
As it stands you have scored around 39-40 marks.. you may just pass.. it's. 50-50 scenario.

Looks like you'll either just pass or just fail. Moderation, if implemented, should definitely pass you. But given that first year is arguably the easiest year, you really need to pull up your socks dude. First year builds the foundation for your GPA in later years.
The paper was tough not so easy bro
Bro what if I have get 15 in ESA

Papers are rarely that straightforward here. You can't study overnight and expect good grades at PES. The people you see with a 9+ CGPA are ones who focus on consistency as well as hard work. Semesters get gradually more difficult as you progress, your workload also increases and other commitments beyond the curriculum also come into existence. These grades now are the easiest you'll ever be able to score, make most of the time now.
